Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an oinochoe or amphora; exterior: black-figure panther (part of forelegs remaining) to right; below, two narrow brown bands and glazed black zone with two superimposed added red bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number 156 is written in pencil on the interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.224) (phase 3)
